downloadDescription: The Azure Storage Mover agent enables the migration of files and folders into Azure Storage.
detailsSection:
Azure Storage Mover enables organizations to efficiently migrate:
  • SMB file shares to Azure Files.
  • NFS file shares to Azure blob containers.
  • NFS file shares to Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2.
  • Convenient tracking and reporting for large scale migrations.
  • Minimize downtime and of your workloads through repeated source/target migrations.

The Azure Storage Mover agent is a Linux appliance in the form of a VM image for Windows Hyper-V and VMware hypervisors.
To learn more:
  • Agent deployment guide
  • Azure Storage Mover overview
systemRequirementsSection:
Recommended, minimal virtual machine configuration:
  • virtual CPUs: 4
  • RAM: 8 GB
  • Disk Space: 20GB

VM resource requirements increase with the scale of a migration. Refer to the agent deployment guide for more details. This agent image is currently supported for running on a Windows Hyper-V and VMWare ESXi 6.7 hypervisor.
installInstructionSection:
1. Download and unpack the agent package.
  2. Create a new VM from the unpacked VM disk image.
    Refer to the agent deployment guide for details.
  3. Register the agent with your storage mover cloud resource.
    Refer to the agent registration guide for details.

You can now manage the agent and your migrations from the Azure portal and Azure PowerShell.
